Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • SuperSmoothMover
        • Entity
  • public abstract class Entity
extends SuperSmoothMover
    The abstract superclass for the moving entities in the world. As an abstract superclass, it contains many different methods that are useful in its subclasses, but its act() method is comparatively barebones. All entities namely have: - Health (and a corresponding bar) - Velocity (direction and speed) - Sprites, or multiple images as opposed to one fixed one. Additional functionalities and implementations are included in the subclasses.
    Version:
    Final
    Author:
    Arthur Zeng and Michael Liu

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity​(int speed,
              int maxHp,
              int direction)
        The constructor for the Entity class mostly facilitates the intialisation of the classes' many fields. Timers are set to 0 (checkTimer to 5), corresponding parameters are set to the appropriate field, and the statBar is intialised.
        Parameters:
        speed - the current and max speed of the Entity to be initialised.
        maxHP - the maximum health of the Entity.
        direction - Either 1 (right), -1 (left), 2 (up), or -2 (down), determining the direction of the entity upon initial spawning

    • Method Detail

      • addedToWorld

        public void addedToWorld​(greenfoot.World w)
        Called when the object is added to the world. Adds the actor's helper StatBar to the world when the actor is added.
        Overrides:
        addedToWorld in class greenfoot.Actor

      • initialiseSprites

        public void initialiseSprites​(java.lang.String type,
                              int sheetSize)
        A useful, "constructor-type" method to initialise sprites. Helps with initialising sprites, as long as naming convention is consistent in the images folder. Iterates through the file system, consecutively and sequentially, based on the sheetSize parameter. Name your sprites as thing#.png - for example, if I want to initialise the skeleton sprites, I would name each sprite "skeleton1.png" to, say, "skeleton8.png"
        Parameters:
        type - the prefix to the sprite name you want (i.e: in a sprite name "man6.jpg", "man" should be passed as type)
        sheetSize - how many sprites you want your Entity to act through - the size of the spriteArray.

      • validPathForward

        public boolean validPathForward()
        Checks if the Entity's forward movement causes them to collide into any Buildings, returns true if it does, false if it doesn't.

      • addReflectedSprites

        public void addReflectedSprites​(java.lang.String type,
                                int sheetSize)
        A useful, "constructor-type" method to initialise inverted sprites. Operates more or less the exact same as the other initialiseSprites method, but inverts the images and adds it to invertedSpriteArray. Iterates through the file system, consecutively and sequentially, based on the sheetSize parameter. Name your sprites as thing#.png - for example, if I want to initialise the skeleton sprites, I would name each sprite "skeleton1.png" to, say, "skeleton8.png"
        Parameters:
        type - the prefix to the sprite name you want (i.e: in a sprite name "man6.jpg", "man" should be passed as type)
        sheetSize - how many sprites you want your Entity to act through - the size of the spriteArray.

      • fullInitialiseAttackSprites

        public void fullInitialiseAttackSprites​(java.lang.String type,
                                        int sheetStart,
                                        int sheetEnd)
        Another useful, "constructor-type" method to initialise an entirely new array of sprites meant to play an attack animation. It combines both initialiseSprites and addReflectedSprites into one method to initialise both straight and inverted attack sprites. Operates slightly differently than the former two methods, as clarified in parameters.
        Parameters:
        type - the prefix to the sprite name you want (i.e: in a sprite name "man6.jpg", "man" should be passed as type)
        sheetStart - the number in the file system of the sprite that signifies the first sprite of a full attack cycle
        sheetEnd - the number in the file system of the sprite that signifies the final sprite of a full attack cycle.

      • movementAnimation

        public void movementAnimation()
        A method meant to facilitate the cycling, or drawing, of movement sprites, depending on the entity's direction.

      • cycle

        public void cycle​(java.util.ArrayList<greenfoot.GreenfootImage> array,
                  int a,
                  int b,
                  int c,
                  int d)
        A method meant to "cycle" through a section of an array of sprites, and draw them upon the Entity every 8 acts.
        Parameters:
        array - the array of images you wish to cycle through
        a - ,b,c,d,e four sequential indices of images from array you would wish to cycle

      • cycle

        public void cycle​(int a,
                  int b,
                  int c,
                  int d)
        A method meant to "cycle" through a section of an array of sprites, and draw them upon the Entity every 8 acts. Overriden to cycle through spriteArray specifically.
        Parameters:
        a - ,b,c,d,e four sequential indices of images from spriteArray you would wish to cycle

      • act

        public void act()
        Act - essentially, enable the movement of entities by calling walk(). This method is called whenever the 'Act' or 'Run' button gets pressed in the environment.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.Actor

      • deathCheck

        public void deathCheck()
        A method meant to be called in act(), which checks if the entity's health is lower or equal to zero, and kills them if it is.

      • checkCollision

        public void checkCollision()
        A timer-based implementation of checkBuilding(), executing every 5 acts.

      • checkBuilding

        public void checkBuilding()
        A method that facilitates the avoidance of Buildings. Changes the entity's direction when it bumps into a Building, keeping in mind other Buildings nearby, or corners.

      • walk

        public void walk()
        A method that enables the 4-directional movement of Entities. Determines which direction the Entity is set to, and moves it along the corresponding direction.

      • die

        public void die()
        No return type no parameter method that deletes the Entity from the world and spawns a skull graphic that fades away.

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage​(double damage)
        Mutator for the hp variable that decrements it by the parameter of damage, and updates their statbar.

      • stopThenDamage

        public void stopThenDamage​(Entity other,
                           int duration,
                           int damage)
        A general-use function that makes the actor stop, then deal damage to another actor.
        Parameters:
        other - the target actor that you want to deal damage to
        duration - the time you want the damaging actor to stop for
        damage - the damage you want to be dealt

      • stopThenDamage

        public void stopThenDamage​(java.lang.Class<?> otherType,
                           int duration,
                           int damage)
        A general-use function that makes the actor stop, then deal damage to another actor of a specific actor type. Does not discriminate based on target, all actors of the other type are fair game.
        Parameters:
        other - the target class type that you want to deal damage to
        duration - the time you want the damaging actor to stop for
        damage - the damage you want to be dealt

      • orientTowards

        public void orientTowards​(greenfoot.Actor other)
        A function that allows the Entity, which uses 4-directional movement, to pursue any target. Every second, it will also check for any Buildings in its path and ideally move out of the way before cycling back to focusing only on pursuing the target.
        Parameters:
        other - the actor you want to be pursued.
